Posted By: Silverware (10/19/2009 10:28:01 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Nice idea, horrible card.  
Should cost 3 mana instead of 4, and 1 or 0 mana and tap to activate instead of 3 and tap. Not to mention the sac ability should be tied to the counters, so it could even be used when this guy is dead and the damage is dealt by the lands (going around most protection abilities). There is no reason why the mines shouldn't explode when the mine layer is gone.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
What I think'd be more interesting would have been something like this:  
  
{W}{W}: Put a trap counter on target land  
  
Whenever a land with a trap counter on it goes to the graveyard, it deals 3 damage to it's owner  
  
There you go, [Armageddon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armageddon).

Posted By: mrredhatter (10/3/2009 6:08:16 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Most cards that involve sacrificing lands better be really good. I would have though that R&D learned that after they released the Prophecy expansion. Even with [Crucible of Worlds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crucible of Worlds) a few sets later, this card is very underwhelming. What's worse, Trap Keeper does the damage himself, not the land, so targeting [Black Knight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Knight) or [Order of the Ebon Hand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Order of the Ebon Hand) aren't possible.
posts.html:
Most cards that involve sacrificing lands better be really good. I would have though that R&D learned that after they released the Prophecy expansion.
